alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 14 at 4:32PM MST until May 14 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 432 PM MST, a dust channel was located near East Mesa, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 193 and 195, and between mile markers 200 and 202. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 32 and 36. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Apache Junction, Queen Creek, Chandler Heights, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport and Gold Camp. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
